skill.name: cobrapy
skill.description: Constraint-based metabolic modeling (COBRA). FBA, FVA, gene knockouts, flux sampling, SBML models, for systems biology and metabolic engineering analysis.
skill.summary: Constraint-based metabolic modeling (COBRA). FBA, FVA, gene knockouts, flux sampling, SBML models, f...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example workflows only. No file access, network calls, or execution logic is present beyond illustrative COBRApy usage.

content.value_statement: You need reliable COBRApy workflows for metabolic modeling. This skill provides clear examples for FBA, FVA, knockouts, and validation.
actual_capabilities: Load and save models in SBML, JSON, and YAML formats
Run FBA, pFBA, and geometric FBA simulations
Perform FVA with loopless and suboptimal settings
Execute single and double gene or reaction deletions
Compute minimal media and modify exchange bounds
Sample flux space and analyze distributions
limitations: Requires a working COBRApy installation and solver
Results depend on model quality and constraints
Does not run wet lab experiments or validate data

use_cases.title: Predict growth phenotypes
use_cases.description: Run FBA and knockout screens to study growth effects in genome scale models.

use_cases.title: Design production strains
use_cases.description: Use production envelopes and gene knockouts to improve target metabolite yield.

use_cases.title: Validate model quality
use_cases.description: Check feasibility, balance, dead ends, and duplicates with validation workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Load and optimize
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the ecoli model, run FBA, and summarize objective value and top 10 fluxes.

prompt_templates.title: FVA with bounds
prompt_templates.prompt: Run FVA at 90 percent optimality and list reactions with the largest flux ranges.

prompt_templates.title: Knockout screen
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform single gene deletions and report essential genes below 0.01 growth.

prompt_templates.title: Minimal medium
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute minimal medium for 50 percent growth and list required exchanges.

output_examples.input: Analyze the ecoli model and identify reactions with the widest flux ranges at optimal growth.
output: Baseline growth is feasible and optimal status is achieved
Top flexible reactions include PFK, PGI, and ENO with large ranges
Several exchange reactions show wide bounds due to medium settings
Recommendation: review bounds for high range reactions before sampling

best_practices: Use context managers to avoid permanent model changes
Check solution status after each optimization
Validate models with slim optimize before deeper analysis
anti_patterns: Assuming results are valid without checking solver status
Changing bounds without restoring original settings
Comparing results across models without consistent media

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides prompts and examples that work across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It relies on COBRApy and a solver, and results depend on model quality.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my own SBML models?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflows include loading and saving SBML models.

faq.question: Does it access or upload my data?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is documentation and does not include data transfer.

faq.question: What if optimization fails or is infeasible?
faq.answer: Check medium bounds, reaction limits, and try a different solver.

faq.question: How does this compare to general Python modeling guides?
faq.answer: It is focused on COBRApy with domain specific workflows and API patterns.
